text: The 1949 European Rowing Championships were rowing championships held on the Bosbaan in the Dutch city of Amsterdam. The competition was for men only, they competed in all seven Olympic boat classes (M1x, M2x, M2-, M2+, M4-, M4+, M8+) in late August. ==Medal summary – men's events== {| class="wikitable" |- ! rowspan="2" | Event ! colspan="2" style="background:gold;"| Gold ! colspan="2" style="background:silver;"| Silver ! colspan="2" style="background:#c96;"| Bronze |- | style="background:gold;"| Country & rowers | style="background:gold;"| Time | style="background:silver;"| Country & rowers | style="background:silver;"| Time | style="background:#c96;"| Country & rowers | style="background:#c96;"| Time |- | M1x | John Kelly | 7:08 | František Vrba | | Hansjakob Keller | |- | M2x | Ebbe Parsner Aage Larsen | 6:57.2 | Mario Ustolin Giorgio Cavallini | | Jacques Maillet Christian Guilbert | |- | M2- | Evert Gunnarsson Bernt Torberntsson | 7:28.2 | Charles Van Antwerpen Jos Rosa | | Felice Fanetti Bruno Boni | |- | M2+ | Giuseppe Ramani Aldo Tarlao Luciano Marion (cox) | 7:55.0 | Leif Hermansen Ole Scavenius Jensen John Vilhelmsen (cox) | 7:55.2 | Eugeen Jacobs Hippolyte Mattelé Cyrille Proost (cox) | |- | M4- | Giuseppe Moioli Elio Morille Giovanni Invernizzi Franco Faggi | | Eivin Kristensen Erik Thorsen Richard Littrup Carl Johan Petersen | | Carl Monssen Harald Kråkenes Thorstein Kråkenes Kristoffer Lepsøe | |- | M4+ | Vladimiro Bobig Mario Tagliapietra Romeo Santin Marcello Basso Eugenio Suzzi (cox) | 6:45.2 | Walter Näpflin Carmelito Bolli Franz Zumbühl Walter Lüchinger Walter Ludin (cox) | | Niels Kristensen Ove Nielsen Peter Hansen Bent Blach Petersen Sv.
